column2: Hold a Bloodletting Ritual
As a [Root.Religion.GetName] ruler, you are expected to offer your blood to the gods. Doing so will legitimize your rule in the eyes of your subjects.

The time has come for you to offer up your blood to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] before the entire realm. This act will show your people that you have a deep connection with the gods, and are thus fit to rule over them. Which body part will you draw blood from?
I will use my hand.
The hand is the easiest part of the body to use, but this means that you will not gain as much respect as you could using a different body part.
I will offer my arm.
The arm is more difficult to use properly, so any rituals involving it will earn you a good deal of respect.
I shall pierce my tongue!
The tongue is by far the hardest body part to use in a bloodletting ritual, but this means that a successful ritual will earn you a great deal of respect.

The ritual was a great success - you expertly pierced your tongue and drew a barbed rope through it to draw blood, before burning it so that it could enter the realm of the gods. Your people were in awe, and, best of all, your tongue has managed to heal completely.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] will surely smile on me!

The ritual was not a success - you drew the barbed rope through your tongue too quickly, and were seen wincing in pain while doing so. Your people were less than impressed, and the wound has become infected.
At least it's over.

The ritual was a total disaster. You misjudged the placement of the piercing, and the pain of drawing the rope through was so excruciating that you nearly passed out. The wound on your tongue refuses to properly heal - it seems as if you will have a lisp from now on.
Have mercy, [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]...

The ritual was a great success - you expertly pierced your arm and drew a barbed rope through it to draw blood, before burning it so that it could enter the realm of the gods. Your people were in awe, and, best of all, your arm has fully healed.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

The ritual was not a success - you drew the barbed rope through your arm too quickly, and were seen wincing in pain while doing so. Your people were less than impressed, and the wound has become infected.
At least it's over.

The ritual was a great success - you expertly pierced your hand and drew a barbed rope through it to draw blood, before burning it so that it could enter the realm of the gods. Your people were in awe, and, best of all, your hand has fully healed.
Praise [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

The ritual was not a success - you drew the barbed rope through your hand too quickly, and were seen wincing in pain while doing so. Your people were less than impressed, and the wound has become infected.
At least it's over.
Animal Sacrifice
As a follower of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, you may conduct a grand animal sacrifice once every three years. Doing so is sure to earn you the favor of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
The time has come for you to sacrifice an animal in the name of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. What kind of animal will you select?
Surely a chicken will do.
You begin the process of locating a suitable chicken.
A pig would make a fine offering.
You begin the process of locating a suitable pig.
Only a the finest heifer will be enough for [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
You begin the process of locating a suitable cow.

You have sent scouts to thoroughly scour your realm for a chicken that is without blemish or defect. Eventually, your scouts bring back a magnificent black-feathered rooster that lacks even the smallest scar anywhere on its body.
This is perfect!
The chicken is prepared for sacrifice.
You have sent scouts to thoroughly scour your realm for a chicken that is without blemish or defect. Eventually, your scouts bring back a large, majestic sow with a perfectly uniform coat of fur.
This is perfect!
The pig is prepared for sacrifice.

You have sent scouts to thoroughly scour tour realm for a heifer that is without blemish or defect. Eventually, your scouts bring back a magnificent brown cow with nary the smallest blemish anywhere on its body.
This is perfect!
The heifer is prepared for sacrifice.

In a grand ceremony, the rooster is presented before your subjects, who marvel at its beauty. It is then ritually slaughtered, with its feathers being carefully removed. Its remains are then burned while holy men chant praise to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
A magnificent sacrifice!

In a grand ceremony, the sow is presented before your subjects, who marvel at its beauty. It is then ritually slaughtered, with care being taken not to unnecessarily damage the body. Its remains are then burned while holy men chant praise to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

In a grand ceremony, the heifer is presented before your subjects, who marvel at its beauty. It is then ritually slaughtered, with care being taken not to unnecessarily damage the body. Its remains are then burned while holy men chant praise to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

I will select Hunab Ku, the Unique God.

Kalom'te Votan

Mayan legends tell of an ancient hero named Votan, guardian of the world, who brought greatness to his people and ruled justly and wisely. Votan's spirit has reincarnated throughout the ages in the bodies of notable Maya leaders, helping to bring them glory or protect them from destruction. Now, there arises his strongest emanation yet. The entire Yucatan peninsula has been united under the banner of [Root.GetTitledName], who is now being hailed as the true and final reincarnation of Votan - Kalom'te Votan.
I will protect my world!
Blood of Kalom'te Votan
Blood of Kalom'te Votan
The legendary Kalom'te Votan united the lands of the Yucatan in the name of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]
Blood of Israel
This former viceroy of the Yucatan shocked Mexico by suddenly converting to Neomayanism and declaring independence from the Mexican Empire.
Blood of Pancho
This stranded adventurer adopted the Neomayan faith while journeying in the jungles of Lacandón and helped peacefully spread it across southern Yucatan.

Claiming to be founded by reincarnations of a great order from millenia before the event, the Twelve Pairs are known for their great exploits against the Ghazis of Mesopotamia and against the Empire of Brazil. These knights have finally expanded north of the Equator after a foothold of the Celeste faith was estabilished.
The Twelve Pairs of France
The Twelve Pairs of France expand north.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] has enlightened us!
Curses!

After their expulsion as heresiarchs from the fringes of Brazil, the Celeste faith has found it difficult to estabilish itself again. However, after the great efforts of [Root.GetName], the Celeste faith has found a new foothold in the North, carving itself a kingdom and estabilishing itself in the region.

And it shall stay that way.
By the blessings of [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName].
Terrible news.
We solved this issue once, and will do it again!

column4: Gebt einen Runenstein in Auftrag

column2: Commission a stele to chronicle your exploits or the memory of a dead parent. This can be done only once in a lifetime, but others will look more favorably on you for a time.
column3: Commander une pierre runique afin de relater vos exploits ou d'honorer la mémoire d'un parent défunt. Ceci ne peut être fait qu'une seule fois par un même seigneur, mais les autres vous seront davantage favorables pendant une certaine période.
column4: Gebt einen Runenstein in Auftrag, um Eure Taten aufzuzeichnen oder ein verstorbenes Elternteil zu ehren. Dies kann nur einmal im Leben getan werden, aber andere werden Euch für eine Weile wohlwollend begegnen.
column6: Encargar una piedra rúnica para escribir una crónica de tus hazañas o la memoria de un padre muerto. Esto se puede hacer sólo una vez en la vida, pero los demás te mirarán más favorablemente por un tiempo.

column2: The craftsmen start the process of carving and painting the stele.
column3: Les sculpteurs ont commencé à graver et à peindre la pierre runique.
column4: Die Handwerker beginnen mit der Herstellung und Bemalung des Runensteins.
column6: Los artesanos comienzan el proceso de tallado y pintura de la piedra rúnica.

column2: You will raise a stele in honor of your own person.
column3: Vous érigerez une pierre runique en votre honneur.
column4: Ihr werdet einen Runenstein zu eigenen Ehren errichten.
column6: Levantarás una piedra rúnica en honor a ti mismo.

column2: You have decided to commission and raise a grand stele for future generations to gaze upon. What should be carved into it?
column3: Vous avez décidé de commander et d'ériger une grande pierre runique que les futures générations pourront admirer. Que souhaitez-vous qu'on y grave ?
column4: Ihr habt Euch entschlossen, einen großen Runenstein in Auftrag zu geben, der von zukünftigen Generationen betrachtet werden kann. Was soll in den Runenstein graviert werden?
column6: Has decidido encargar y levantar una gran piedra rúnica para que contemplen las generaciones futuras. ¿Qué debería tallarse en ella?

column2: Let it speak of me.
column3: Qu'elle parle de moi.
column4: Lasst ihn von mir sprechen.
column6: Que hable de mí.

column2: It shall stand in memory of [Root.Father.GetTitledFirstName], my departed father.
column3: Elle sera érigée à la mémoire [Root.Father.Get_du_TitledFirstName], mon défunt père.
column4: Er soll zu Ehren meines verstorbenen Vaters [Root.Father.GetTitledFirstName] errichtet werden.
column6: Debe alzarse en memoria de [Root.Father.GetTitledFirstName], mi difunto padre.

column2: It shall stand in memory of [Root.Mother.GetTitledFirstName], my beloved mother.
column3: Elle sera érigée à la mémoire [Root.Mother.Get_du_TitledFirstName], ma défunte mère.
column4: Er soll zu Ehren meiner geliebten Mutter [Root.Mother.GetTitledFirstName] errichtet werden.
column6: Debe alzarse en memoria de [Root.Mother.GetTitledFirstName], mi querida madre.

column2: The artisans who will carve and paint the stele are asking for instructions. Which of your qualities should it speak of?
column3: Les artisans qui graveront et peindront la pierre runique demandent des instructions. Lesquelles de vos aptitudes seront exposées ?
column4: Die Künstler, die den Runenstein bearbeiten und gravieren werden, bitten um Anweisungen. Von welcher Eurer Qualitäten wollt Ihr berichten?
column6: Los artesanos que tallarán y pintarán la piedra rúnica están pidiendo instrucciones. ¿De cuáles de sus cualidades debería hablar?

column2: Oh, I don't know. Make something up.
column3: Oh, je ne sais pas. Improvisez.
column4: Oh, ich weiß nicht. Lasst euch was einfallen.
column6: Oh, no lo sé. Inventa algo.

column2: I know exactly what the stone should say...
column3: Je sais précisément ce qu'on pourra lire sur la pierre...
column4: Ich weiß ganz genau, was der Runenstein sagen soll...
column6: Sé exactamente lo que la piedra debe decir...

column2: It schall shpeak of wine, schpirits, *hic* and other ssusch wondersch.
column3: Elle devra parler d'hydromel, de schpiritueux, *hic* et d'autres mmerveilles de la schorte.
column4: Er scholl vonn Mmet, Geischtern *hicks* und anderen scholschen Wundern berrschichten.
column6: Debe habbblar de aguamielll, licccores, * hip * y otrasss maravillasss.

column2: It must share my beauty with the world.
column3: Elle doit exposer ma beauté au reste du monde.
column4: Er soll meine Schönheit mit der Welt teilen.
column6: Debe compartir mi belleza con el mundo.

column2: Let it show what a giant I was despite my stature.
column3: Elle montrera que, malgré mon gabarit, j'étais un géant.
column4: Lasst ihn verkünden, was für ein Riese ich war, wenn man mal von meiner Statur absieht.
column6: Que muestre lo gigante que era a pesar de mi estatura.

column2: My wisdom must be preserved.
column3: Ma sagesse doit être conservée.
column4: Meine Weisheit muss für die Nachwelt festgehalten werden.
column6: Mi sabiduría debe ser preservada.

column2: Uhm... you decide...
column3: Heu... à vous de voir...
column4: Ähm... Ihr entscheidet...
column6: Uhm... decide tú...

column2: The runes must say that I had the strength of ten men!
column3: Les runes diront que je possédais la force de dix hommes !
column4: Die Runen sollen davon berichten, dass ich die Stärke von zehn Mann hatte!
column6: ¡Las runas deben decir que tenía la fuerza de diez hombres!

column2: My great knowledge of the world.
column3: Ma grande connaissance du monde.
column4: Mein gewaltiges Wissen um diese Welt.
column6: Mi gran conocimiento del mundo.

column2: I care not what you write, but it must show my impaled enemies!
column3: Je ne me soucie guère de ce que vous y écrirez, en autant qu'elle illustre mes ennemis empalés !
column4: Mir gleich was dort steht, er soll meine aufgespießten Gegner zeigen!
column6: No importa lo que escribas, pero ¡debe mostrar mis enemigos empalados!

column2: It should speak of summer fields, moonlit nights and...
column3: Elle parlera de champs d'été, de nuits de pleine lune et...
column4: Er sollte von sommerlichen Feldern und mondbeschienenen Nächten berichten und...
column6: Debe hablar de los campos de verano, las noches iluminadas por la luna y...

column2: Just carve in my image and make sure it is well-endowed.
column3: Gravez seulement mon image et assurez-vous que ça me mette en valeur.
column4: Graviert mein Abbild in den Stein und stellt sicher, dass die Ausstattung stimmt.
column6: Sólo talla mi imagen y asegúrate de que está bien dotado.

column2: Carve in all of my favorite recipes.
column3: Gravez toutes mes recettes préférées.
column4: Graviert meine Lieblingsrezepte hinein.
column6: Tallar todas mis recetas favoritas.

column2: Let it speak of sharing.
column3: Qu'elle parle de partage.
column4: Es soll vom Teilen berichten.
column6: Que hable de compartir.

column2: It should mention the importance of being kind to others.
column3: Elle pourra faire mention de l'importance d'être bon envers les autres.
column4: Es sollte erwähnt werden, wie wichtig es ist, zu anderen freundlich zu sein.
column6: Debería mencionar la importancia de ser amable con los demás.

column2: You will mention my greatness and the epic deeds I have performed.
column3: Vous y mentionnerez ma grandeur et toutes mes épopées.
column4: Ihr werdet meine Großartigkeit und meine epischen Taten erwähnen.
column6: Va a hablar de mi grandeza y la epopeya que he realizado.

column2: Oh, there is not much to say...
column3: Oh, il y a beaucoup à dire...
column4: Ach, da gibt es nicht viel zu sagen...
column6: Oh, no hay mucho que decir...

column2: It will say that I feared nothing.
column3: Elle dira que je n'ai peur de rien.
column4: Man wird sagen, ich hatte vor nichts Angst.
column6: Dirá que no temí nada.

column2: I wish to be known for my fairness in all things.
column3: Je souhaite être reconnu pour mon équité en toutes choses.
column4: Ich möchte für meine Gerechtigkeit in allen Belangen berühmt sein.
column6: Deseo ser conocido por mi justicia en todas las cosas.

column2: My strong bonds to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].
column3: Mes liens solides avec Odin.
column4: Meine starken Bindungen zu Odin.
column6: Mis fuertes lazos con Odín.

column2: My harsh but necessary actions.
column3: Mes actions rudes mais nécessaires.
column4: Meine brutalen, aber notwendigen Taten.
column6: Mis acciones duras pero necesarias.

column2: The demon within me must be heard.
column3: Le démon en moi doit être entendu.
column4: Der Dämon in mir muss gehört werden.
column6: El demonio dentro de mí debe ser escuchado.

column2: My Neomayan faith.
column3: Ma foi chrétienne.
column4: Mein christlicher Glaube.
column6: Mi fe Cristiana.

column2: In Memory of [Root.Father.GetFirstName]
column3: En mémoire de [Root.Father.GetFirstName]
column4: In Erinnerung an [Root.Father.GetFirstName]
column6: En memoria de [Root.Father.GetFirstName]

column2:
The stele you commissioned has been finished and raised on the spot you chose for it. You examine the glyphs:

This stele was raised by [Root.GetFirstName] in memory of [Root.Father.GetFirstName], [Root.GetHerHis] father and [Root.Father.Father.GetFirstName]'s son. He lived a good life and died peacefully in bed. Ever will stand this memorial.

You leave the stele, content in the knowledge that many centuries from now, when its paint has long since faded, scholars will be studying these glyphs in an effort to glean the wisdom of their words.
column3:
La pierre runique que vous avez commandée est terminée et a été érigée à l'endroit que vous aviez choisi. Vous examinez les runes :

'Cette pierre a été érigée par [Root.GetFirstName] à la mémoire de son père [Root.Father.GetFirstName]. Il a vécu une bonne vie et est décédé paisiblement dans son sommeil. À jamais se dressera ce monument commémoratif.'

Vous partez avec la satisfaction de savoir que, dans bon nombre de siècles, quand la peinture se sera depuis longtemps estompée, des érudits étudieront ces runes gravées pour essayer d'en retrouver la sagesse.
column4:
Der von Euch in Auftrag gegebene Runenstein wurde fertiggestellt und an der Stelle errichtet, die Ihr ausgewählt hattet. Ihr untersucht die Runen:

"Dieser Stein wurde von [Root.GetFirstName] zu Ehren von [Root.Father.GetFirstName], [Root.GetHerHis]em Vater, errichtet. Er lebte ein gutes Leben und verstarb friedlich in seinem Bett. Sein Andenken wird immer gewahrt werden."

Ihr verlasst den Ort, zufrieden in dem Wissen, dass noch in vielen Generationen Gelehrte die eingravierten Runen in dem Bemühen studieren werden, die Weisheit aus ihnen herauszubekommen. Auch dann wenn die Farbe des Steins bereits verblasst sein wird.
column6:
La piedra rúnica que encargaste se ha terminado y alzado en el lugar que elegiste para ella. Examinas las runas:

Esta piedra fue alzada por [Root.GetFirstName] en memoria de [Root.Father.GetFirstName], padre de [Root.GetHerHis] e hijo de [Root.Father.Father.GetFirstName]. Vivió una buena vida y murió tranquilamente en la cama. Que este memorial dure para siempre.

Dejas la piedra, conforme sabiendo que dentro de muchos siglos, cuando su pintura haya desaparecido mucho tiempo atrás, los eruditos estarán estudiando estas tallas de runas en un esfuerzo por recoger la sabiduría de sus palabras.

I am a Macho Stallion!
I am a Night Mare!
All followers of Aria de Machete must take a stand on whether they believe men or women should rule. Are you a Macho Stallion, or a Night Mare?
Pray for Prosperity
As a follower of Aria de Machete, I may pray to the great Rucio Moro for prosperity in my lands. However, the Rucio is not obligated to answer my prayers...
You pray for prosperity. Rucio Moro tends to be more receptive to prayers from the deserving...
A Storm for Rucio Moro

Rucio Moro is the ranchero of thunder, death and rain. The Rucio is said to ritualistically die every single time that there is a thunderstorm, the lighting takes away one of his mortal forms so he can reborn as the other. He either appears as a beautiful stallion or as an androgynous human whose genitals are dependent on the observer.\n\nI sing the song of Rucio to the heavens, hoping that he will bring prosperity to my lands.
I pray to the one who is stallion and dame!

Last night a thunderstorm erupted, the rains will without a doubt bring a lot of prosperity to my land and my people. As I ride on my horse I see a figure in the distance. I cant tell if its a man or a woman, but it brings great joy to my heart.
Beautiful either way.
The sky has been clear for weeks now, there is no sign of rain. If things continue like this, the cattle will die and with it the herders. Rucio Moro refuses to answer my prayer.
Just die already, you shapeshifting horse!
Blessing of Rucio Moro
Rucio Moro has blessed this ruler with abundant rains.
Blessing of Rucio Moro
Rucio Moro has blessed this ruler with abundant rains.
Curse of Rucio Moro
Rucio Moro has cursed this ruler with dry soil.
Curse of Rucio Moro
Rucio Moro has cursed this ruler with dry soil.
Cast Love Spell
As a follower of Aria de Machete, I can perform a ritual to invoke the will of Sayona and make a suitor of my choice fall in love with me. Success is not guaranteed, however...
You prepare the materials for the spell...
The Dark Love of Sayona

Sayona is the ranchera of love and vengeance. Once a woman, she was murdered by her jealous lover who chopped one of her legs. After descending to hell she battled death itself to be able to return among the mortals to enact her vengeance...\n\nAs I burn frankincense while covered in a black mantle and stating in one leg, I sing the song of Sayona so the lady may give me [Root.GetName]s hearth."
Bring me passion, lady of the dark mantle!
The spell is cast...
The other day I encountered [From.GetName] and I noticed that [From.GetSheHe] couldnt stop staring at me with a loving gaze. Without a doubt, La Sayonas lust spell has worked.
Now I have a little puppet.
I want this to be a real love story!
The other day I encountered [From.GetName] and [From.GetSheHe] looked at me as one looks at dry manure. Has La Sayona forsaken me? But I did everything right...
I only wanted love!
Deeply Infatuated
Disdain
Cast Health Spell
As a follower of Aria de Machete, I can perform a ritual to invoke the will of Bolefuego and ask her to determine the health of my child. Exactly how it is determined is up to me...
You prepare the materials for the spell...
The Cursed Touch of Bolefuego

La Bolefuego is the ranchera of fire, health and premonition. The dame of light is a being made of pure fire who appears to expecting mothers. She is said to bring health to those newborns who are destined greatness and death to those who are not worthy, to make sure that they are not a burden to their families\n\nAs I fill my room with candles and sing the chant of flame I whisper [From.GetName]'s name. But what do I want for the little one?
Protect the little one, oh mother of flames!
Your child's health will be improved.
This child is a burden, take the young soul!
Your child's health will be worsened.
[From.GetName] seems to have very rosy cheeks and a lot of energy lately. The mother of fire has decided that the young one deserves life.
Thus is her will of light.
[From.GetName] seems to be very tired and has completely stopped laughing lately. The mother of fire has decided that the young one is a burden for his family.
Thus is her will of fire.
Blessing of Bolefuego
This character has been blessed by Bolefuego with good health.
Curse of Bolefuego
This character has been cursed by Bolefuego with poor health.
Pray for Strength
As a follower of Aria de Machete, I can pray for myself or one of my close friends to receive the blessing of the war rancho Florentino. However, Florentino may not hear my pleas...
You pray that you will receive Florentino's blessing.
You pray that this character will receive Florentino's blessing.
A Devilish Florentino

Florentino Cazadiablos is the ranchero of music and war. He is said to have defeated the devil himself in a harp duel. His figure appears in the heavens during great battles to favor those who march to war with the dignity of a poet. Llanero commanders hope to hear Florentinos harp in the battlefield as it is a clear sign of victory.\n\nAs I play my harp I sing the old Florentino y el diablo, hoping that it will bring me strength.
Face the devil and win!
You wait a few weeks for the prayer to take effect...

Florentino Cazadiablos is the ranchero of music and war. He is said to have defeated the devil himself in a harp duel. His figure appears in the heavens during great battles to favor those who march to war with the dignity of a poet. Llanero commanders hope to hear Florentinos harp in the battlefield as it is a clear sign of victory.\n\nIf target is a third: As I play my harp I sing the old Florentino y el diablo, hoping that it will bring [From.GetName] strength.

As I do a military exercise, the sun hits me in the eyes and for a second I see a man in the clouds holding and harp. I feel the strength of Florentino in me and know that I could face the impossible and still win.
This is the strength of a devil hunter!
Once in a while I look at the sky hoping to see Florentino in the clouds, but my eyes dont sense his form, my ears dont catch his harp. My prayers are for nothing, I am doomed to mediocrity.
What a miserable outcome...

As I watch [From.GetName] ride a horse in the field I see for a second what looks like a man with a harp floating near the beasts behind. There is no doubt, [From.GetName] is now blessed by Florentino.
Poor [From.GetName] looks tired and sad all the time. I hoped that praying to Florentino would bring blessings, but it was all for nothing.
As I ride my horse in the field, I look behind me. For an instant, I swear I can see a man with a harp floating behind my steed...
I have been blessed by Florentino!
For some reason, I have been feeling incredibly tired and depressed recently. I cannot figure out why...
Have I been cursed by Florentino?
Cazadiablos
This character has been blessed by Florentino Cazadiablos, the ranchero of music and war.
Pray for Fertility

As a follower of Aria de Machete, I can pray for myself or one of my close friends to receive the blessing of the fertility ranchero Juan Machete. However, Juan Machete may not take kindly to my pestering...
You pray that you will receive Juan Machete's blessing.
You pray that this character will receive Juan Machete's blessing.
A Mans Machete

Juan Machete is the ranchero of fertility, blood and the night. A legendary figure that can make both bulls and men breed like rabbits. He is an undead and cruel being who only respect the strongest men.\n\nAt midnight I went to an empty field, took a chicken and a toad, sewed their eyes and then buried them alive. Then I started singing the old song of the machete, demanding a blessing for my manhood.
I am a man and this is my demand!
You wait a few weeks for the prayer to take effect...

Juan Machete is the ranchero of fertility, blood and the night. A legendary figure that can make both bulls and men breed like rabbits. He is an undead and cruel being who only respect the strongest men.\n\nAt midnight I went to an empty field, took a chicken and a toad, sewed their eyes and then buried them alive. Then I started singing the old song of the machete, hoping that [From.GetName] would become more fertile.

I had a dream last night. I saw myself ridding a black bull who breathed fire. And before me a herd of cows, stretching to the horizon. When I woke up my manhood was already awake and asking for passion.
The spirit is strong!
My manhood is asleep. I have being trying for an hour and its still asleep. I prayed for the opposite of this. To hell with Juan Machete!
The flesh is weak.
I had a dream last night. I saw [From.GetName] riding a black bull who breathed fire. If this is a sign from Juan Machete, then [From.GetName] will soon have a new child.
[From.GetName] looks bored and dispassionate. I prayed that Juan Machete would would bring lust and appetite to [From.GetHerHim], but apparently it had the opposite effect.
I had a dream last night. I saw myself riding a black bull who breathed fire. Could this be a blessing from Juan Machete?
I have recently been more dispassionate than usual, rejecting my the advances of others more than usual. Where is Juan Machete when you need him?
High Libido
This character has been gifted with a high libido by Juan Machete.
Low Libido
This character has been cursed with a low libido by Juan Machete.

Gran Colombia, the Great Fatherland of the ancient golden era, was founded and ruled by heroic saints known as próceres. In the modern era the most devout are able to invoke those immortal spirits so they may grant their blessings. It is only a matter of choosing a saint.
Santander, the lawmaker.
Bolívar, the warrior of liberty.
Manuelita, the dame of love.

Francisco de Paula Santander, called Saint Francis or the man of the laws. Santander is the great legislator, a sage who puts integrity and peace above all. His faithful enjoy his blessing when it comes to governing large areas of land and have the wisdom of always choosing a virtuous successor.
Only the laws will give you freedom.

Simón Bolívar, called Simón Pedro or Saint Peter. The liberator, who breaks the chains and brings death to the tyrants. Bolívar is the saint of war and freedom. His faithful are called to take up arms against those who oppose the spirit of liberty by all possible means and to give all their children equal rights in succession.
I shall fight for liberty!

Manuelita Saenz, the Magdalene, is the great saint of fertility and love. The identity of the lady is twofold, as the most faithful defender and consort of her beloved Bolívar but also as a liberated woman who never got tied to a single lover. Her followers are called to prioritize passion, family and love.
In the name of love!
Meditate on the Marquess of Garcia
The old ritual of Mamar Gallo allows you to enter a trance while reading the old works of the mad prophet, the Marquess of Garcia.
The Ritual of the Mad Marquess

The Marquess of García was the crazy prophet who predicted the arrival of The Event and the collapse of the golden age, as well as the second coming of a new Libertador destined to unify the Great Fatherland once again. His extensive volumes survive only in fragmentary compilations, haphazardly translated from Old Costeño. These volumes are mystical and metaphorical, so it is necessary to enter a trance to fully understand them.\n\nDuring the ancient ritual known as "Mamar Gallo" a person must ingest special herbs that allow the mind to wander to a higher plane while reading the text. Today you have prepared yourself to be part of this ceremony.
Mad prophet, make me hear the próceres!
You begin the ritual...
The mystical vapors make you hear the voices of the old próceres, they tell you to look for a passage between the volumes of the Marquess of Garcia. But which one do they guide you to?
The Lonesome Century.
The Patriarch's Fall.
Choleric Romance.
The Lady of the Remedies

The passage transports you. You are now a woman from the Rolo lands, wandering through the corridors of an old house. The walls are covered with drawings made of human excrement and the atmosphere is suffocating. Finally you see a light and, walking towards it, you find a patio. In the center of it is the most beautiful woman in the world.\n\nYou contemplate the angelic being as she hangs clothes to dry, but before you can do anything, she begins to ascend to the heavens, no doubt to meet with the próceres. You cannot help but regret that she took the clothes she was hanging with her.
A vision of beauty.
The Child on the Cross

The passage transports you. You are now a woman from the Wayuu lands. You have a peaceful life, knowing that your oldest child has recently married and lives happily. That is, until you see a path of blood slowly spreading on the ground beneath your feet.\n\nTerrified, you follow the bloody path. It takes you outside your home, around the block, through the butcher shop, the shoe store and the town square. You follow the path of blood through alleys and avenues until it finally reaches the doors of your son's house. You feel as if your heart is suffocated. You know that a tragedy awaits you inside that house.
A vision of loss.
The Patriarch in Glory

The passage transports you. You are now in a magnificent palace. Before you is an intimidating man, and you know immediately that he is a prócer. The saint, who reigns somewhere in the Patria Grande during the golden age, is being celebrated for his greatest achievement. He has totally expelled the Catholics from the country.\n\nThe prócer, deciding that it would be better to hold his celebration in the morning than in the afternoon, gives a simple decree: "It shall be eight in the morning." As soon as he says these words you can see through the window how the sun descends toward dawn. You understand now that this is the true power of a man of the golden age.
A visionW of power.
The Patriarch in Misery

The passage transports you. You are now facing the sea and next to you is an aging man who calls himself a prócer. You hear a fierce roar and you can see a gigantic iron dragonfly descending from the heavens, which has come to take the sea. The beast is being controlled by a perverse Americanist priest who wants to steal what is left of the golden age.\n\nDesperate, you beg the old saint to do something and stop the heathen, but he just ignores you. You know then that the golden age has come to an end and the Patria Grande is lost.
A vision of defeat.
Carnivals of Love

The passage transports you. You are now a young man celebrating the carnival somewhere in the Costeño lands. With you is a beautiful woman, devoted to Manuelita the Magdalene, who has promised to teach you the arts of love. However, once you undress you realize that the woman has drawn a dagger.\n\nTerrified, you run away from her, only to end up in the streets completely naked. Instead of helping you, people laugh at your shame and the madness of the woman chasing you, as they believe it is nothing but a carnival joke. You finally realize how strange the golden age really was.
A vision of madness.
The Eternal Ship

The passage transports you. You are now an old woman in the golden age, and by fate you find yourself on a ship with a man whom you loved half a century earlier. All your life you have been pious and devoted to Saint Francis, but today you have entrusted yourself to the Magdalene with the hope that she will bless you in romance.\n\nYour prayers have been heard and a love that you thought wasted long ago is once again within your reach. You decide then that you will never leave the ship that now houses you both, for in this place time does not pass, your love will not die and the golden age will never end.
A vision of love.
Vision of Beauty
This character experienced a vision of beauty while meditating on the Marquess of Garcia.
Vision of Loss
This character experienced a vision of loss while meditating on the Marquess of Garcia.
Vision of Power
This character experienced a vision of power while meditating on the Marquess of Garcia.

Hold the Novena de Aguinaldos
The Novena is a several day-long festival of prayer and celebration to commemorate the symbolical birth of the Divino Niño.
The time has come to invite my vassals to the Novena.
Send the invitations!
The Novena de Aguinaldos begins!
You send invitations to your vassals for the Novena de Aguinaldos.
Your liege, [From.GetName], has invited you to his Novena de Aguinaldos celebration.
Of course I will attend!
You accept the invitation.
I don't think so...
You decline the invitation.
Your vassal, [From.GetName], has declined your invitation and will not attend your Novena de Aguinaldos celebration.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]!

Each year, family and friends gather to celebrate the Novena de Aguinaldos. The celebration which includes food, song and prayer is meant to last several days and marks the end of the year and the symbolic birth of the Divino Niño. This year, I have decided to invite all the notable people of my domain to the celebration.
The most wonderful time of the year!

The holiday season starts with the Día de las Velitas, in which all houses must decorate their porches with little candles to guide the coming of the Divino Niño and his mother. Before the guests arrive I could get the candles ready, but some may say that this just a distraction for kids and peasants.
This is just childrens entertainment.
A lovely tradition!

The guess have arrived and its time to pray the Novena de Aguinaldos. We all take turns reading part of the old prayer and as the host its important that I take part on this myself. But should I take the lead with the opening prayers or accept a smaller role?
The opening and closing prayers!
Just one of the shorter gozos.
I dont care for these old ramblings.

The last of the days prayers are done and now is time for the feast and festivities. Today we are gathered together as friends and family to remember the birth of the Divino Niño, and this is cause for celebration.
Praised be the Divino Niño!

As the year ends we prepare one last tradition. A human sized doll is made with rags. This is the Old Year and we will set it on fire. We shall fill it with notes, and in them will be all our problems and flaws. Lets burn this Old Year and leave the past behind.
Burn the sadness. New Year, New Life!
Burn my sins. I can be better!
Burn myself, I am the Old Year!
The holidays are now over and with it the celebrations. As I start to take down the decorations and wish the guests a good journey back home, I am filled with a sense of new beginnings.
Happy New Year!
The holidays are now over and with it the celebrations. As I bid farewell to my generous host, I am filled with a sense of new beginnings.
Happy New Year!
The Sword of Saint Peter

A proud [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] enters your throne room, a huge weapon on [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] shoulder. [relic_hunter.GetSheHeCap] bows, and when [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] holds out the weapon you see it is a huge two-handed sword, made of untarnished steel... 'My search has been long and difficult,' your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] says, 'but what I bring you can be no other than the sword wielded by Saint Simon Bolivar himself!'

You take the axe and inspect it. It does indeed bear a striking resemblance to the description you've heard of it, from legend. It feels heavy and powerful in your hands, and though it might not be the perfect weapon in combat you definitely exude an air of authority around you while you wield it...

Your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle], at least, seems impressed, as [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] waits for you to speak.
The Stone of Saint Francis

Paired with a brief, but heavy downpour, a drenched [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] returns from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] lengthy travels. Once in your presence, [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] produces a small box, and opens it to reveal a beautiful, strange stone. With a solemn face [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] hands it to you. 'This... This stone is what killed Saint Francis... His kidney stone. It must be. The sky wept as we carried it aloft...'

You hold the stone in your hand, and ponder the earlier downpour's sudden onset. It makes sense! And with this stone, your own health may improve. Other than the obvious benefit to yourself, this should also make your realm more stable.

The [relic_hunter.GetManWoman] who made it possible smiles at your elation, waiting patiently...

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] comes before you, proudly carrying a necklace made of the finest pearls. Handing the garment to you reverently, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] explains: 'After a long and arduous search, I have recovered the legendary Pearls of the Magdalene!'

Despite its immense age, you find no damage whatsoever on any of the pearls as you inspect them. This can only be interpreted as proof of its provenance! Donning it yourself would certainly make you much more popular among your subjects.

As you ponder this find's implications, your [relic_hunter.GetJobTitle] is seemingly waiting for a reward...

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an unbelievable find! Llorante's flower vase, long thought to have been lost and destroyed at the end of the Golden Age, seems to have survived, and has now returned to its rightful Patria Grande holders! This magnificent vessel, in red, purple and gold, will display beautifully in my throne room.
The Fastest Gun

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] enters your throne room, holding a large hunk of iron in their hands. As [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] approaches, you realize that what they are holding is no mere hunk of iron - it is an ancient firearm! [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] presents it to you. 'My liege, you should feel very lucky. This, right here, is the fastest gun in the whole Range.'\n\nYou take the firearm and inspect it. As you place your finger on the trigger, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] flinches and shouts 'I assure you, it is very much functional!' Ignoring [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] pleas, you take aim at a corner of your throne room and fire. A thunderclap erupts, causing everyone else present to jump. You, however, crack a grin. You feel very lucky indeed. [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] collects themselves and waits for you to speak.
The Pen of Black Bart

[relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] enters your throne room, holding a curious black tube in their hands. As [relic_hunter.GetSheHe] approaches, you realize that the tube has a small metal tip on the end. [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] presents it to you. 'My liege, this is the very pen Black Bart used to vanquish Far-Gone-Wells and earn his place as a god.'\n\nYou take the pen and examine it, before calling for some parchment. If the legends are true, this pen should work without ink. The parchment is brought before you, and you begin to sign your name. Sure enough, your name is written onto the parchment. As you examine the bold strokes, you get the impression that the letters were not truly penned with your hand. It is almost as if Black Bart himself wrote these words. [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] looks at the parchment, waiting for you to speak.

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an unbelievable find! The Roadrunner's flying feathers, long thought to have been lost to time. According to Trailwalker legend, Sly Coyote's theft of these feathers was what initiated their ancient feud. Much of their magic is gone, but you swear you see an otherworldly glow around them...

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an unbelievable find! The Golden Stake, said to have been struck into the earth by the Iron Horse's servant Mancho at the very spot where Iron Horse finished his crossing of the world. From it sprung an immovable road, giving mankind the gift of swift travel across the Range.

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an unbelievable find! Garcia's pig tail, whose existence was dismissed by many as a pure flight of fancy, not only exists but is now in your possession. Some of your servants appear unnerved by its presence, but you feel nothing but amazement.

Returning from [relic_hunter.GetHerHis] travels, [relic_hunter.GetTitledFirstName] has brought with [relic_hunter.GetHerHim] an unbelievable find! It is the skull of a Thunder Lizard, a long dead beast that is said to have roamed the earth alongside man in the days before the Event. Its teeth are as long as knives and are said to have been just as sharp. Could such beasts have really walked the earth?
Followers of Saint Simon Bolivar can subjugate other Patria Grande rulers for §Y500§! Piety.
Manuelita Divorce
As a follower of Manuelita, you can divorce your spouse freely, without seeking permission from the Caudillo.
You divorce your spouse. You doubt [From.GetSheHe] will be happy...
Consult A Court
As a follower of the Tres Potencias, you can consult one of your faith's great courts of spirits for guidance.
You decide which court you will turn to for need.
You have decided to seek advice from one of your faith's many spiritual courts. Which one will you rely on?
The Indigenous Court.
You gather the appropriate offerings and contact holy men to consult the Indigenous Court, inhabited by the spirits of wise and noble ancient rulers.
The Black Court.
You gather the appropriate offerings and contact holy men to consult the Black Court, inhabited by the spirits of the most brilliant and brave soldiers in Venezuelan history.
The Medical Court.
You gather the appropriate offerings and contact holy men to consult the Medical Court, inhabited by the spirits of knowledgeable physical and spiritual healers.
I seek the advice of a different court.
You examine the other courts.
There are more courts available who can give you valuable advice. Which one will you rely on?
The Court of the Teachers.
You gather the appropriate offerings and contact holy men to consult the Court of the Teachers, inhabited by the spirits of the most learned scholars and philosophers of the ages.
The Court of the Juans.
You gather the appropriate offerings and contact holy men to consult the Court of the Juans, inhabited by the spirits of great storytellers and womanizers.
The Celestial Court.
You gather the appropriate offerings and contact holy men to consult the Celestial Court, inhabited by the spirits of saints and pious men.
I seek the advice of a different court.
You examine yet more courts.
There are even more courts available, each with their own advice. Which one will you rely on?
The Political Court.
You gather the appropriate offerings and contact holy men to consult the Political Court, inhabited by the spirits of well-spoken statesmen.
The Viking Court.
You gather the appropriate offerings and contact holy men to consult the Viking Court, inhabited by the spirits of wild warriors and explorers.
The Court of the Malandros.
You gather the appropriate offerings and contact holy men to consult the Court of the Malandros, inhabited by the spirits of crafty criminals and rogues.
Perhaps one of the other courts would do...
You think once more about the first group of courts.
The Indigenous Court

The Indigenous Court is headed by the great chief and potencia Guaicaipuro, the wise Venezuelan chief who bravely opposed foreign conquest. The Banco and medium you have contacted for this ceremony begin the ritual by lighting yellow candles and consuming an offering of corn. As the Banco utters a prayer to the Court, you can see something in the medium's eyes change. The medium begins to speak...
What is your advice, great spirits?
The medium relays advice from the spirits.
The Black Court

The Black Court is headed by the great warrior and potencia Felipe, the brave general who led the Liberator's forces in battle against foreign lords. The Banco and medium you have contacted for this ceremony arrive, and the ritual begins with the Banco dousing you with aguardiente and blowing tobacco smoke on the medium. As the Banco lights yellow candles and the medium finishes eating the corn offering, you can see something in the medium's eyes change. The medium begins to speak...
The Medical Court

The Medical Court is headed by the great doctor José Gregorio, who is said to have healed the most serious ailments with a single touch. The Banco and medium you have contacted for this ceremony arrive, and the ritual begins with the Banco dousing you with aguardiente and blowing tobacco smoke on the medium. As the Banco lights red candles and the medium finishes eating the offering of molasses and pork rinds, you can see something in the medium's eyes change. The medium begins to speak...
The Court of the Teachers

The Court of the Teachers is headed by the great poet Andrés Bello, whose words could move even the most stone-hearted men. The Banco and medium you have contacted for this ceremony arrive, and the ritual begins with the Banco dousing you with aguardiente and blowing tobacco smoke on the medium. As the Banco lights white candles and the medium finishes drawing a design in chalk on the floor, you can see something in the medium's eyes change. The medium begins to speak...
The Court of the Juans

The Court of the Juans is headed by great musicians of the bambuco and gaita zuliania style, who hands could navigate instruments and women with equal skill. The Banco and medium you have contacted for this ceremony arrive, and the ritual begins with the Banco dousing you with aguardiente and blowing tobacco smoke on the medium. As the Banco lights multicolored candles and the medium finishes drinking the offering of aguardiente, you can see something in the medium's eyes change. The medium begins to speak...
The Celestial Court

The Celestial Court is headed by Jesús and his mother Maria, along with many who died in their names. This court is among the oldest and most prominent in all of Tres Potencias. The Banco and medium you have contacted for this ceremony arrive, and the ritual begins with the Banco dousing you with aguardiente and blowing tobacco smoke on the medium. As the Banco lights white candles and the medium begins handling the offering of beads, you can see something in the medium's eyes change. The medium begins to speak...
The Political Court

The Political Court is headed by the great Simón Bolívar, who commands statesmen in his current realm as he commanded soldiers in life. The Banco and medium you have contacted for this ceremony arrive, and the ritual begins with the Banco dousing you with aguardiente and blowing tobacco smoke on the medium. As the Banco lights multicolored candles and the medium finishes smoking the offering of tobacco, you can see something in the medium's eyes change. The medium begins to speak...
The Viking Court

The Viking Court is one of the most curious in all of Tres Potencias, and is inhabited by wild and passionate warriors from a long-distant time and place. The Banco and medium you have contacted for this ceremony arrive, and the ritual begins with the Banco dousing you with aguardiente and blowing tobacco smoke on the medium. As the Banco lights red candles and the medium finishes drinking the offerings of rum and brandy, you can see something in the medium's eyes change. The medium begins to speak...
The Court of the Malandros

The Court of the Malandros is often disparaged. Although their actions may be disagreeable to some, these malandros performed them so well that they form a court of their own. The Banco and medium you have contacted for this ceremony arrive, and the ritual begins with the Banco dousing you with aguardiente and blowing tobacco smoke on the medium. As the Banco lights white candles and the hat-clad medium finishes the offering of tobacco and rum, you can see something in the medium's eyes change. The medium begins to speak...
Consulted Indigenous Court
This character has consulted the Indigenous Court using a medium, receiving valuable advice from them.

This character has consulted the Black Court using a medium, receiving valuable advice from them.

Consulted Court of the Malandros
This character has consulted the Court of the Malandros using a medium, receiving valuable advice from them.
Make Pilgrimage to Sorte
Pious followers of the Tres Potencias regularly make pilgrimage to the holy mountain of Sorte to participate in rituals and become closer to the spirits. Perhaps you should go sometime...
You prepare for your pilgrimage to Sorte.
You have packed your bags, and your retinue is assembled. You are finally ready to travel to the holy mountain of Sorte.
Let us be off!
You begin your journey to the Altar Mayor of Sorte.
During my travels, I encounter a family of poor beggars on the side of the road. They ask me if I can spare some coin so they may eat tonight.
Of course I will help!
You exercise the gift of charity and assist the family.
Sorry, I do not have any spare coin.
You withhold your charity from the villagers.
As I push myself to reach my destination, my retinue informs me that I should slow down, lest I contract an illness. To be fair, I have been feeling a little under the weather recently...
Nonsense. I will persevere!
Perhaps they have a point...
I came across a group of other travelers and decided to spend the evening with them. They are having a polite yet highly engaging discussion that is dragging on late into the night.
Perhaps if I listen, I can learn something new.
You listen intently to the conversation.
I will join in and provide my own opinions.
You join the conversation.

I encountered a fellow traveler on my journey yesterday, and we spent the entire evening telling stories, making jokes, and generally enjoying ourselves. Perhaps I should invite them to join my retinue?
Of course I should!
Your new friend joins your court!
I don't have room...
You and your new friend part ways.
As I continue down the road, I begin to wonder about the true purpose of my journey. Why exactly are pilgrimages important?
To become closer to the gods, of course.
To make good friends and good memories.
Sorte Mountain

As you take the final steps to the summit of Sorte and the Altar Mayor, you are amazed at what you see. The mountaintop is thronged by thousands of devout Tres Potencia devotees. Some are worshipping at shrines to María Lionza herself, others are reciting chants for good fortune, and some spiritually-gifted mediums are channeling spirits to the amazement and adoration of their fellow pilgrims. You are amazed at the ferocious devotion to the Tres Potencias displayed by everyone present.
Praise María Lionza!
Night falls...

You wake up in the middle of the night and wander out onto the summit. A fire-dancing ceremony is in progress - pilgrims are jumping through flaming circles and dancing on embers while others spit alcohol directly under their feet. Amazingly, these pilgrims emerge unscathed.
Let me dance among the flames!
You participate in the fire dance.
I think I'll go back to bed...
You decide that fire dancing is not for you.

You step cautiously towards the fire pit as other pilgrims chant words of encouragement. Bracing yourself, you jump onto the burning embers and... feel nothing. Energized, you spontaneously erupt into a dance, to the cheers of your fellow pilgrims.
The fire is in my soul!

You step cautiously towards the fire pit as other pilgrims chant words of encouragement. Tensing up, you step timidly onto the burning embers... and you yelp in pain. As you jump around, you lose your balance, falling headfirst into the embers...
It burns!
As you finally return to your castle, you reflect on the events of your journey. Although it had its ups and downs, you cannot deny that it was a positive experience overall.
I should go again sometime...
As you finally return to your castle, you reflect on the events of your journey. Honestly, it could've gone better. You're still nursing the burn wounds you received...
Next time, no fire dancing.
Develop Sympathy
The Tres Potencias and their courts have absorbed spirits and influences from many other religious traditions. Perhaps we are more alike than we think...
You decide which foreign tradition is closest to your own practices.
Since its inception, the Tres Potencias faith has incorporated influences from many foreign religious traditions. Which one of these is closest to your own personal views?
Jesús and Maria are almost as great as the Tres Potencias themselves.
The saints are not so different from the spirits...
We share many spirits in common with the pagans...
The Colombian Dream

More than a century ago the old caudillo Zacarías ruled over all of Colombia. His destiny was to conquer the Great Fatherland and unite the faithful once more under a single banner. That destiny was interrupted when the perfidious pagans of the east took his life, dooming the world to a century of darkness and our family to perpetual decadence.\n\nBut there was once a dream named Colombia, and there is those who still dare to speak about it, even if its just whispers. Maybe, just maybe, its worth listening to those whispers. Maybe its worth dreaming once more.
I am listening and dreaming as well.
I do like decadence.

A young commander called Paulino Aragonés has being rising among the ranks lately. His accomplishments have made him very successful at recruiting troops, giving our armies a strength that I wasnt expecting. And yet, there is something about him I just dont trust.
An... interesting man.

I met a traveller from an antique land who said his name is Raymond McQueen. He is whiling to make great investments in our land in exchange for a seat at my council and a monopoly on trade over the Bogotá River. A tempting offer, but selling away those rights would be very unpopular with the commoners who depend on the river for their subsistence.
My sovereignty is not for sale!
It is... tempting.
Sold Sovereignty
This character has sold a portion of their sovereignty for gold, angering their subjects.

My father couldnt let go of his pride. His obsession with restoring our domains in the Llanos made him reject our subjects' language and faith. That is what doomed him and that is what brought me to the throne. But perhaps there was virtue on that pride. We are a family of Llaneros, and as such we conquered this land.
I have the blood of the Llanos and Machete.
Bolívar is my father, and its people are my family.

The Queen has denied our gods and returned to the perfidious ways of her father. Does she not realize that we deposed her brother because of his belief in Juan Machete and his rejection of our culture?
The time has come to end her tyranny!
I will bide my time...
To [Root.GetName],\n\nSimoneta has abandoned the ways of the Tres Potencias. I plan to declare our independence - but I need your help to do so...
Of course I will support you.
Perhaps not yet...
A Death Foretold

My uncles told me that my father defiled my mother and in defense of her honor they took his life. I grew up thinking this was true, that mine was cursed blood. But today my mother revealed to me the secret of my birth, that she loved my father with all her hearth and that my uncles used her as a pretext for their own ambitions, only to dump us both in this miserable land once they were done.\n\nMy name is Bayardo Nasar, true blood of House Nasar. Heir of a murdered father. Son of a betrayed mother. And I will have my vengeance...
...in this life or the next!

I walk into the church and kneel in front of Bolívars shrine. I prepared my words beforehand so I can speak loud and clear. Saint Peter, saint of war, I have never prayed to you before. I have no tongue for it. I came to make an offer. I will train every day, and I will make the steel an extension of my arm. I will dedicate every second of my life to you, and I only ask one thing in return. Grant me revenge. And if you do not listen...
...to hell with you!
Form El Templo Mayor
For too long, we have been persecuted in our own land. The time has come to reclaim the holy city of Tenochtitlan and restore the ancient priesthood!
El Templo Mayor

The ancient city of Tenochtitlan once more belongs to its rightful owners, the followers of Mictlantecuhtli. [From.GetTitledName], the ruler of Tenochtitlan, has decided that the time is right to revive the priesthood of the Mictlantec religion. The head priest, known as the Mictlantecuhtli Tlamacazqui, has been universally recognized as the supreme spiritual leader of all Mictlantecs.
Tenochtitlan will not fall again!
Intersting...
Blasted heathens!
Industrial Tycoons

Rustish scavengers in heathen lands suffer all manner of abuse and the routes are not safe. In order to protect the scavengers and secure the holy cities for Ford and the faithful, [Root.GetHerHis] Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], has accepted the possibility of an outright invasion by joint Rust Cultist forces. This signals a new era of large scale Rustish holy wars - the Industrial Actions.
For Ford!
As long as they don't bother us...
Filthy heathens!

Pittsburgh, the easternmost bastion of Rust Cultism, has fallen. The dire situation has convinced [Root.GetHerHis] Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], to accept the possibility of an outright invasion by joint Rust Cultist forces. This signals a new era of large scale Rustish holy wars - the Industrial Actions.

Detroit, the very seat of the Forge-Saint [Root.GetHerselfHimself], has fallen to infidels. In response, the Saint-in-exile, [Root.GetHerHis] Holiness [Root.GetTitledName], has declared [Root.GetHerHis] intention to forge a great alliance of Rust Cultist lords in order to reclaim the shining city. This signals a new era of large scale Rustish holy wars - the Industrial Actions.

The very heartlands of Rust Cultism are under siege by infidels! Desperate Rustish lords and ladies have persuaded [Root.GetHerHis] Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], to declare [Root.GetHerHis] intention of forging a great and righteous alliance to expel the heathens in the name of Ford. This signals a new era of large scale Rustish holy wars - the Industrial Actions.
The Era of Industrial Action has Begun\n
Mend the Ursuline Schism
The Ursuline Schism saw Canada reject the authority of the Pope, but if Catholic control were re-established in Quebec City, we may be able to convince the Ursulines to once more follow the Pope.
The §YKingdom of Quebec§! is NOT §YUrsuline§! or a heresy\n
Holder is §YCatholic§!, §YNeo-Gnostic§!, §YSedevacantist§! or §YNestorian§! and NOT a heretic\n
The Ursuline Schism is mended and Catholicism reunited.
The Ursuline Schism Mended

At last the schism between the Catholic Church and the Ursuline Order has been mended. With the spread of Catholicism and the conquest of Quebec, including the bishopric of Quebec City, the Ursuline faith now holds little sway over the people of Canada. There will be those who still cling to it, but they will be few in number and the Holy See can once more claim rule over all North American Catholics.

column2: Mend the American Schism

The followers of the American Papacy excommunicated us for our devotion to the Ursuline See, despite their claim to apostolic succession being shaky to begin with. If Ursuline control were re-established in St. Louis, we may be able to convince the world that the Pope is illegitimate.

The American Schism is mended.
The American Schism Mended

At last the schism between the Ursuline See and the American Papacy has been mended. With the spread of Ursulinism and the conquest of Missouri, including the bishopric of St. Louis, the Catholic faith now holds little sway over the people of America. There will be those who still cling to it, but they will be few in number and the Ursuline See can now claim ruler over all North American Catholics.
Vassalize the Archbishop of Canterbury

Now that we have reunited the legendary Dominion of Canada, we may be able to convince the Archbishop of Canterbury to submit to imperial rule. Doing so would further legitimize our rule of the great white north.
