You have somehow managed to lose your way in the middle of a desolate road. However, as luck would have it, there is another group of travelers ahead of you. Perhaps they know the way?
Hello! Where is the nearest town?
I can make my own way.
While traveling down a secluded path, you are suddenly accosted by a group of armed bandits. "Do as we say, and nobody will get hurt." Your carriage crew looks to you...
I will give them what they want.
Someone will get hurt, but it won't be me!
As you stop to rest for the night, you notice that your carriage crew has begun playing a game of cards. You could probably join the next round if you asked.
I will join!
Lady Luck has her way with your purse...
Perhaps not...
Your cart has broken down in the middle of the road. Your crew has begun their repairs, but it seems to be a difficult job...
I will help them!
That is what servants are for, no?
As your journey continues, you begin to ponder the deeper aspects of Cetic philosophy. Night has fallen, but there is much to think about...
I will continue to ponder these mysteries.
I'd rather get some sleep.

You have gotten lost near a fork in the road. As you look for landmarks, you see a mysterious woman clad in white beckoning you. As approach, she points down the right path of the fork before disappearing. What could this mean?
This is a good omen! To the right!
I don't trust her. To the left.
During the night, you look up to the sky and see a brilliant streak of light. The streak heads towards the imperial capital of Sacramento and slowly fades from view. It must have been a comet...
There are dangerous times ahead...
There are interesting times ahead!

You have come across an inn on the side of the road, and have decided to stay the night inside. The bar is very active-- it seems as if there are many travelers on the road this time of year. What will you do?
I think I'll just go to bed.
Barkeep! Bring me your best wine!
I will regale the patrons with amazing stories!
Say, is that [Root.GetManWomanOpp] here alone?
Say, is that [Root.GetManWoman] here alone?

As you approach your destination, you look to the west and see a magnificent sunset over the mighty waters of the Pacific. It is somehow more beautiful than any sunset you have ever seen before in your life. This alone has made your pilgrimage worth it.
Marvelous.
As you approach Sacramento, you stop by a river to fill your canteen. However, you notice a glint in the water... it is a nugget of gold!
Gold! Gold!
You have spent a magical night at the inn with your new companion, but the time has come for you to return to the road. As luck would have it, though, your companion is headed the same way...
Let us travel together, my love.
What happens on pilgrimage stays on pilgrimage.
Sacramento

You have arrived in Sacramento, home to the great Imperial Palace. You marvel at its grandeur and stature. It is truly greater than any other building in the entire Empire. This sight alone has made your journey worth it, but there are still places to visit and gurus to listen to...
One more look...
San Francisco

You have arrived in San Francisco, the great Golden City. After carefully navigating through the city's treacherous sloped streets, you have finally arrived at the ruins of the Golden Gate Bridge. This structure, which once spanned the San Francisco Bay and permitted easy travel from one side to the other, collapsed centuries ago. Visitng it allows you to reflect on how the passage of time brings an end to all things, no matter how grand.
What a magnificent view!
Los Angeles

You have arrived in Los Angeles, the great Glittering City. Los Angeles is famed for being one of the most diverse cities in the Empire, and as you travel through its sprawling streets you hear snippets of conversation in a multitude of tongues. You eventually stop at a shrine with walls constructed of tiles with golden stars and names on them. These tiles were laid on streets of Hollywood during the days of the Hays Code, and they featured the names of both wise Gurus and less honorable men. After the fall of the Hays Code, many of these tiles were destroyed, but some were preserved and placed on the walls of this Shrine.
I should see a show while I'm here...
San Diego

You have arrived in San Diego, the great southern anchor of the Empire. As you walk through the ancient Balboa Park, you notice a small path leading to a "Friendship Garden". As you walk down the path, you are met with a spectacular sight - it is one of the grandest and most austere gardens you have ever seen in your life, complete with a large koi pond. Who knew that such a treasure could be hidden here?
I wonder if I can feed the koi...
Redwood

You have arrived in the great Redwood Forest, situated in the far northwest of the Empire. As you walk through the misty trails, you are struck by the sheer size of the trees around you. They may very well be the tallest things you have ever seen in your entire life. You could spend hours just standing and staring upwards...
I must not get lost, though.

You encounter a traveling guru with a moderately large audience. You decide to sit down and join them. As he speaks, you are struck by the clarity and simplicity of his speech. This guru is truly wise...
I have learned something new!
You have come across a shrine to one of the great gurus of the past. As you sit and meditate before the shrine, you realize something about yourself that you had not considered before...
I should change my ways!

Despite being home to the Emperor, Sacramento is home to a sizeable Christian minority. As you travel through the city, you happen upon a group of them praying in the open. Somehow, they do not seem so different from you...
Jesus was a Guru, was he not?
They are misguided.
We are not.
San Francisco is home to both one of the largest Christian populations in the Empire and one of its most notable Muslim shrines. Perhaps they are not so different from you...
Muhammad was a Guru, was he not?

Los Angeles is one of the most religiously diverse cities in the entire empire. Cetics, followers of Christ, and adherents of other faiths comingle and coexist in peace. Perhaps they are not so different from you.
Saints are Gurus by a different name.
The Prophet was a great man.

San Diego hosts large Muslim and Christian populations, including adherents of a unique Christian sect that does not have much of a following elsewhere. Despite this, however, there is not much strife in the city. Perhaps they are not so different from you...
Smith was a Guru, was he not?

The Redwoods were the site of the great Green Sash Rebellion, which saw the General of the Gaians lead the north of the Empire in a revolt against Imperial rule. Although they had initial success, the rebellion was brought to a brutal end by Imperial forces, who burned redwoods and people alike to end the strife.
Perhaps the General had the right idea...
They deserved it.
Mother Gaia will have her revenge...

The city of Sacramento is associated with the Way of the Fist in Cetic philosophy, as it was the home of the First Emperor. Therefore, during your visit, you became completely immersed in the philosophy of the Fist and learned new things about it. You have become impressed by this Way...
I am a follower of the Fist!
Alas, it is not for me.
And I am proud to follow it!

The city of San Francisco is associated with the Way of the Book in Cetic philosophy, as it has been home to many great poets and scholars throughout history. Therefore, during your visit, you became completely immersed in the philosophy of the Book and learned new things about it. You have become impressed by this Way....
I am a follower of the Book!

The city of Los Angeles is associated with the Way of the Cowl in Cetic philosophy, as it was the home of the Hays Code in ancient times. Therefore, during your visit, you became completely immersed in the philosophy of the Cowl and learned new things about it. You have become impressed by this Way....
I am a follower of the Cowl!

The city of San Diego is associated with the Way of the Dove in Cetic philosophy, as it was the center of the cult of the Sacred Heart in the days before imperial rule. Therefore, during your visit, you became completely immersed in the philosophy of the Dove and learned new things about it. You have become impressed by this Way....
I am a follower of the Dove!

The redwoods of northern California are associated with the way of the Branch in Cetic philosophy, as it was the center of Gaian belief in the days before imperial rule. Therefore, during your visit, you became completely immersed in the philosophy of the Branch and learned new things about it. You have become impressed by this Way....
I am a follower of the Branch!
After a long and eventful journey, you have finally returned home. You are ready to use the insights you gleaned during your visit to improve the quality of your rule.
I had a grand time!
Che's Form

Che Guevara is remembered by many for his outstanding military victories and his wise and prosperous rule. Under his lead, liberty was brought to the largest island in the Carribbean, Cuba.\nMany rulers have wasted their lives hopelessly trying to match him in stature. As the [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], I have certainly come closer than most, and I wonder now if the feats of my family are proof enough that the glorious spirit of Guevara is being manifested through our bloodline, all the way to myself.
Attempt to forge a claim to §YGuevara's Bloodline§!.

As a celebrated [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], I have already a greater claim to Che's legacy than many other [Root.Culture.GetName] rulers, yet, in order for me to be formally recognized as a reincarnation of the heroic Guerrillero, I must submit myself to the judgment of the wisest amongst us.\nI will call for the oldest and most prestigious priests in the Caribbean and allow them to examine my life and judge my character, so that they can confirm to my peers and subjects what I already know is the truth.
Che's Bravery

The wise priests that have gathered in [Root.Capital.GetName] to examine and determine whether I am worthy of calling myself heir to Che or not claim that, before anything else, I must prove my courage to them.\nDespite his lack of formal experience in combat, he proved unparalleled bravery during the course of his life, surpassing all expectations to arise as a paragon of virtue and discipline.\nIf I truly am the new Guerrillero of the Caribbean, it should be easy for me to prove that I have the fortitude to meet my bold claim.

It has been months now, yet the priests are unsatisfied with my conduct.
They claim that I have failed to meet the standards of Che's divine valor, of his enlightened leadership in battle and strategic skills.
If I truly am his manifestation, I should not dread the prospect of facing my enemies and my insecurities. 
Until I have proven to them the purity of my intent, they will not allow me to proceed to the next phase of their test.
Abandon your quest to claim §YGuevara's Bloodline§!.
Che's Ambition

Che may have done much, but his ambitions were always greater than his accomplishments, even unto his death.\nAlthough he was able to throw a tyrannical yoke from the neck of Cuba, he dreamed of doing the same to the entire world. He believed in this cause so much that he died trying to accomplish it.\nIf I am Che's manifestation, then I must remember the grand dream he held onto for his entire life.
Che's Charity

Che's bravery and ambition was matched only by his charity. Despite his immense accomplishments, Che took none of the wealth he acquired for himself, instead distributing it to the poor peasants of Cuba. This act, above all others, is what made him a legend across Cuba and the Caribbean. Che eventually died deep in the jungle with little food or supplies, proving beyond all doubt that he took only what he needed for himself\n\nThe priests state that, in order to be acknowledged as Che's new form, I will need to prove that I am just as charitable.

The priests are not satisfied with my show of charity.\nThey claim that merely giving some gold to the less fortunate is not enough when compared with Che's immense sacrifice.\nThey say that my display is vacuous at best in comparison as the gifts that I am giving to my subjects I will take back in time as their [Root.GetTitle].
But Che was their ruler too!
Che's Manifestation

It was not an easy task to convince the priests, but their final response was inevitable.
It was only a matter of time before my true nature was revealed for all the world to admire. 
I am the manifestation of Che, the great liberator of Cuba.
By returning in the form of [Root.GetFullName] I will unify the people of this great land under a new regime of Harmony and Virtue, just like I did in my past life and just like my successors will continue to do after I leave this body.

After a long, laborious ordeal, [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been announced by a council of priests as the second coming of Che.\nAfter having liberated Latin America once already in the form of Che, this great spirit has been reborn in the [From.GetOnlyDynastyName] and [From.GetSheHe] is now set to achieve this glorious feat for the second time.\nUnder [From.GetHerHis] rule, the Caribbean is sure to know peace, prosperity and harmony for centuries to come.
Change Apostolic School
You have the opportunity to reconsider which school of worship to follow. This should not be taken lightly...
The Mountain [Root.GetEmperorEmpress]

Since the time of the Event, many have believed that the Rocky Mountains could never be reunified. The numerous natural barriers and inhospitable terrain seemed to make such a task impossible, as these obstacles would make conquest and administration equally unviable. However, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has proven this theory wrong by placing the entire Rockies under one banner. Hopefully, their enlightened rule will prevent the region from falling to barbarism once more.
I am a true mountaineer!
Atomic Quarantine

One of the professors in your realm has come to you with distressing news. An ancient ruin containing vessels of the vile destroyer Atomos, which had been contained by Aphite professors centuries ago, has had one of its seals broken recently. The vile corruption of Atomos now threatens to escape from its vessels and spread across your lands, leading to disease, chaos, and ruin. Your priest exhorts you to travel to the site and seal up the great evil once more, before it is too late.
I will travel there at once!
You visit the ancient ruin.
The ancient professors used multiple seals. This is no matter.
You do not re-contain the ruin, trusting in the wisdom of the ancient professors.

You have arrived at the site of the ancient ruin. The sheer scope of the structure leaves you in awe-- the professors of the past must have taken the threat of Atomos very seriously to invest such time and resources into this facility. However, time has taken its toll on it - one of the inner walls appears to have collapsed, exposing the cursed barrels inside to the elements. All it would take now is a storm or an over-curious traveller to unleash the corruption your ancestors fought so hard to contain. You must rebuild the wall... but with what?
A thick layer of steel should be enough.
You spend a week gathering steel for use in the resealing.
The Shield manifests itself in lead, does it not?
You spend a week gathering lead for use in the resealing.
The rubble in front of the hole should do.
You look around the ruin to find as much rubble as you can.

You have gathered the materials necessary to re-establish the seal and re-contain the vile power of Atomos. However, you must now move the material into place. This is easier said than done - the hole is absolutely enormous, and it will take either immense strength or the help of multiple people to get this done in any reasonable amount of time.
I should be able to manage this by myself.
You move the material into place by yourself.
I won't even break a sweat!
I should be able to convince the local peasants to do their holy duty...
You recruit the locals to assist you in your effort.
I will have to pay up for the locals to deal with Atomos...
I don't have the time or resources to see this through.
You abandon your efforts for good, leaving the ruin uncontained.

It has taken days of grueling work, but you are nearly finished re-establishing the seal. All that is left to do is to move the final brick into place. With one final heave, you manage to do it. You stand back in front of the wall, admiring your work... only to realize that you can't see it. You were standing on the wrong side of the wall. You are now trapped inside the ruin, with nothing protecting you from the cursed barrels of Atomos.
I must remain calm... there has to be another way out of here!
You feel around in the dark for another way out.
A Vision of Doom

As you carefully navigate the interior of the ruin, you find a rare unlocked door. As you open it, your vision is filled with a bright light. You think you've found the way out... but then your eyes adjust.

You are floating above the ruin, looking down at the wall you built. Suddenly a terrible, piercing sound fills the air. The wall crumbles away, and a terrible green fog emerges from the hole...
The wall you built is incapable of containing the power of Atomos. Your efforts were in vain.
Suddenly, the vision ends, and you find yourself outside.
I have failed...
You return home in defeat.
A Vision of Truth

As you carefully navigate the interior of the ruin, you find a rare unlocked door. You step inside, and everything seems even darker...\nThe doorway behind you is gone. There is nothing around you-- it is a void. A bright flash fills your vision, and you can now see... the night sky? But not from below. It is almost as if you are in the firmament itself, traversing the stars. You are suddenly thrown forward, stopping above the Earth. Your vision focuses on a glimmering pre-Event city. Another bright flash fills your vision, and... the city is destroyed. You finally understand the truth of Atomos. His power both creates and destroys-- but by creating on the grand scale, it destroys on the the human scale.\nSuddenly, the vision ends, and you find yourself outside.
I must deliver this truth to the world!
You emerge with renewed purpose.
Vision of Truth
This character understands the truth of Atomos.

We will retake our homeland!

Not again...

This is an outrage!
Good for them!

A joyous occasion!
